text: Not to be confused with Naosaurus, a genus of pelycosaur. Nurosaurus is the informal name given to a genus of Sauropod dinosaur. It was from the Cretaceous period in Inner Mongolia, China. It was a herbivore or plant-eater. "Nurosaurus" grew to about long. The proposed binomial name is Nurosaurus qaganensis (Dong 1992). == References == Category:Sauropods Category:Cretaceous dinosaurs
title: Nurosaurus
